title: Why is Xerath being nerfed before Miss Fortune?
body:
Now I don't disagree with Xerath being nerfed so don't misunderstand me.... but MF hasn't been touched in MONTHS and has a far higher winrate than Xerath with almost 3x his pickrate to top it off. 

Oh and Riot is actually indirectly buffing her by making black cleaver even stronger...

replies.body: We're testing some direct changes to MF right now, we'll be shipping something on 7.24b. She'll also be getting knocked down a few begs from changes to sorcery that are going out with the patch as well.
TWITCH
Has a negative win rate right now because he is bad vs lane bullies and in shorter games.
Implying that winrate has anything to do with game health or design? He is a problem and HAS been a problem.
I don't feel like his winrate unrelated problems can be resolved by simple change of numbers, though.

Making his stealth not bullshit would be an excellent start.

He has a lower detection range than {{champion:107}} and {{champion:28}}.  Two MELEE who can only burst ONE person, while he can "DPS" an entire team in 3 seconds.

 The fuck????
Vayne is the same way. Low win rate but still unhealthy .
twitch sitting  at like a 50% there more problems bigger than twitch
Because he's a late game one shot champ, games don't last that long.
They're not so much shorter but I think the bursty damage meta doesn't favor him as much
Oh no I'm not denying he can burst you, but he used to be much stronger when games lasted longer. a 6 item Twitch would actually kill you in less than a second. You couldn't react to it.

Actually I meant it's easier to murder him the second he comes out of stealth and he's more easily bullied in the lane phase now that poke/engage is in and healbots are out. That's probably why he's worse, not game length
Malzahar just  got nerfed...

Lets not forget about anivia
I wish I could forget about her, but Anivia at least takes some skill and has to wait until level 6 to get her easy waveclear spell. Malzahar has access to his at level 1 :(

I've noticed since the pre-season changes that except for a few pretty major outliers (MF and Ez, mostly) no Marksmen are particularly standing out right now.

Do you suppose this has something to do with how stompy early game has gotten due to lower resistance/HP?  If mistakes are punished MUCH harder, it seems to me that the state of bot lane would tend to lean 'who makes the first slip-up' rather than what champ you're playing, since everyone explodes equally fast now.

Personal belief is that the early game domination of sorcery (primarily comet) and lethality, are a bit overtuned, allowing utility marksman like MF/Jhin/Varus to crowd out other marksman that need to scale up with gold. We're looking at some changes which should start making that less true, and as such I'd expect we start to see a re-emergence of some more variety of bot laners, but we shall see!

TBH not sure why you're getting downvoted, it's a reasonable question :/

As awkward as it sounds, the sorcery tree with comet is the only keystone variant Camille has any kind of success with.

She is in a really awkward spot when it comes to keystone choices....
Seeing that sorcery and comet get nerfs, she will probably suffer alot and it doesn't change that she has no synergy with any keystone choice.

I know there are plans to provide more runes in the future, I hope it will address this problem, but it will probably take a long long time....

If you want to bring MF, jhin, and varus back down to size, then here's a suggestion

Majorly reduce the lethality bonuses on RANGED attacks and champs. It's *daggers* for *assassins*, and the assassin class was meant to rush them. Giving ADCs an item conducive to large burst in short periods of time, and ADCs are a class meant for whittling down the front line from afar, it kinda seems wonky that at 2900 gold you finish your lethality item which lets you shitstomp everyone in lane with a couple Qs and autos

for me utility marksman have more ways to deal cc...like ashe/varus/jhin.

are the changes to Miss Fortune power nerfs or power neutral? are they targeting adc MF or support MF?

ADC MF is only strong because sorcery is strong...

and MF support is only played because she has lane priority when coupled with Jhin or Ashe and pros value the first turret a lot. She isn't even good in pro play past the first turret cheese, she falls off harder than a rock.

Imo, what you need to do is target her support position with power neutral changes, her E is fairly obnoxious at level 1-6, but that's the extent of it. Gotta find a way to make that E spell less obnoxious without taking too much power away from it,  maybe by pushing back the damage it does over time to the last tick only, so it's not as effective when used solely to poke unless the target is also rooted or stunned. Say, instead of slowing the target and dealing damage every 0.25 seconds for 2 seconds, it slows the target every 0.25 second for 2 seconds and only then deals damage after 2 seconds. Or something like that.

EDIT: also something that might be worth looking into, arcane comet and MF E make it rain have a wonky interaction and her E will trigger arcane comet cooldown reduction effect multiple times I believe to as much as 40% cdr if it hits one player, up to 100% if it hits more than 2 players (it's 10% per enemy hit every 0.5 second, it can easily reach 100% if her E hits more than two players), which is probably not intended.

"Direct changes" doesn't say nerfs. 
But she's getting nerfed since we are nerfing Mages Keystone.  Does anyone else smell anything over the Bullshit.  Clear & direct language.
 Please and thank you

I mean I would rather just nerf lethality, or add more arm, since personally, and I get that I don't have all the numbers, but I feel like she ain't really broken just the lack of armor is the problem.
So you're double-tapping her in one patch? Have you guys not learned? You can't nerf the champion and nerf the item/rune that was making them strong in the same patch.

Fine but why xerath nerf. He was useless for like 3 whole seasons. Now even with comet and best possible runes he is outshined by any champion in the midlane. His skillshots literally the easiest to dodge in the game. Eithout this damage his q will be useless both in early and late. Why cant you just fix runes that you think are the problem? Ezreal was dumbster tier with 47% winrate as adc for a long time and when klepto makes him too strong you nerf ezreal instead of unhealthy synergy with klepto and rune itself. He is only good because he gets item faster before crit adcs but once enemy adc gets ie and zeal item it gets harder for him. There are so many champions needing a nerf and you choose those that either are too strong thanks to runes or not strong at all like xerath.

So I gotta ask, do you know of any plans to make Akali less oppressive toplane?

She takes large dumps on a lot of toplaners while also outscaling the non-tanks.

Akali's roams aren't a problem for the most part because it's easy to notice when she left lane because of how much damage she does.

Akali's sustain makes her near-unkillable in the laning phase when it's 1v1 and a toplaner VS Akali is being played.

Akali has easy escapes and a lack of way for most Melee champs to retaliate her damage when she uses W(sure it's on a 20-ish second cooldown earlygame, but Akali still has the passive damage + sustain that makes this overpowered).

I'd seriously like to stop being useless for the first 20 minutes from enemies playing Akali top and being almost as oppressive as a Pantheon.

Hello. As a support MF player, can you comment on whether or not the changes are going to break supportune again? Every time AD MF gets strong it feels  like she gets nerfs intended to pull back her power as a marksman, but they inordinately hit the support kit, so that you have a minor nerf to her AD when it is too strong, and a major champion-breaking nerf to her support kit which was never that good to begin with.
